summary: The project manager introduced the upcoming project to the team members and then the team members participated in an exercise in which they drew their favorite animal and discussed what they liked about the animal. The project manager talked about the project finances and selling prices. The team then discussed various features to consider in making the remote.
actions: The industrial designer will work on the working design of the remote. The user interface designer will work on the technical functions of the remote. The marketing executive will work on what requirements the remote has to fulfill
decisions: The remote will sell for 25 Euro. The remote will be sold on an international scale. The production costs cannot exceed 12.50 Euro.
problems: Whether the remote will be used exclusively for televisions.

During this third meeting of our design team we set ourselves to the task of using reports from each team member to make decisions on the design concept for the next stages of planning.  The information brought to the meeting included market trend research, available cosmetic features for the unit and a specific user interface proposal.  
The challenge during this meeting was to begin incorporating as many of the production goals as possible in one concept.  The decisions made were done in great haste as time was limited.  We settled on a design using an "8" shape, with a jog-dial for channel selection, a concealed audio control compartment, lemon-lime colour scheme and backlighting.  It was also decided that if possible, the unit would be kinetic powered.  My feeling is that not enough time or focus was spent developing the two top design priorities: fashionable look-and-feel,  and high-tech innovation.

Final Report
Decisions made in Kick-Off Meeting:
	Product should control multiple devices, eg VCR, DVD, Stereo, etc 
	Product should look good/trendy 
Decisions made in Functional Design Meeting:
	Which requirements were essential, and which were ideal
	Target group = 15-35 age bracket 
	Use of speech recognition - yes
	Product powered by conventional,non-rechargeable batteries
	Grouping products functions into 3 categories - audio, video & other
Decisions made in Conceptual Design Meeting:
	Product will be made of plastic & rubber 
	"Snowman" shape 
	Gimmicky backlighting and LEDs inside case
	No need for "talk back" or LCD
	Jog dial to be incorporated 
	Corporate colour (yellow) to feature heavily in design
	Corporate slogan to feature on product
	
Decisions made in Detailed Design Meeting:
	Due to financial restraints, the LCD & advanced chip were removed from the design
	The final prototype was produced.
	
	Final Design:
	
	The final design is a snow man shape, of dimensions 10x3x2.5 cm.
	The materials used are yellow, blue and red plastic.
	Push buttons and an integrated scroll wheel/ pushbutton were used for input.
	The companys logo and slogan are printed on the device.
	Batteries are the only power source.
	Functionalities are: Volume control, Power on/off, visual settings (brightness, contrast), channel tuning, auxiliary input settings, sounds settings (bass, treble, balance, pre-programmed sound modes).
	Cost of final design is 12.4 euros.

The production cost of the remote control was calculated, and some design features (LCD & extra material) were removed to keep to the budget.
The design process was evaluated:
Room for creativity: financial and time constraints meant that creative process was a bit confined.  A more relaxed environment (without headsets, etc) might have been more conducive to creativity.
Leadership: personal coach, project manager, etc meant for a lot of structure  perhaps too much.
Team work: would have been easier if we could have communicated outside meetings.  Tools available to us didnt really support collaboration.  The actual work involved was quite isolated.
Means: would have preferred to use the whiteboard more, and powerpoint less.  Too many presentations.  Digital pens are quite chunky but easy enough to use.  Computers provided distraction in meetings.  Play dough very useful.
